intro: Cupania cordierorum, commonly known as the Cordier's cupuaio, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. Its botanical features include woody stems and capsule fruits that release seeds when mature. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
